answers.answer: Well, there are a variety of findings here that point to several diseases.Shortness of breath on exertion can be indicative of heart or lung disease.  Although he is already on blood thinners for a clot, I would re-check for a pulmonary embolus.  This can be done with a CT scan, and if present despite the blood thinners, an IVC filter may need to be considered.If the lungs are clear, I would evaluate the heart with a stress test.Can't comment on the rash without seeing it, but a dermatology evaluation may be prudent, and discussion of whether a skin biopsy would be helpful.The nerve damage can further evaluated with nerve conduction studies, and blood tests to evaluate for diabetes, vitamin B12, and thyroid disorders.  A referral to a neurologist can be considered to further evaluate this finding.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin Pho, M.D.www.kevinmd.comwww.twitter.com/kevinmd

question: My husband gave up his job as a die maker after 20 years because he wasn't feeling well (tired and achy)  He is 52 years old.  He did this 2 years ago.  He decided to become a truck driver, thinking this would be easier on his body.  after 6 weeks of truck driving he ended up with several blood clots in his leg and one in his lung.  He receives his treatment at our local VA Hospital.Since that time his blood pressure was sky high and they put him on meds  This is a list of my concerns:Keep raising/changin his blood pressure medspain in his legs and a lot of discomfortany exertion makes it hard to breathe and wears him out for days (he does smoke)he has a rash on his face, chest and back2 different times he has had a lot of blood in his urine for 24 hour periodhe is on blood thinnershe has tested positive for the gene marker HLBA27.  He has 4 siblings and each of them tested positive for it and all have joint, muscle disorders (2 have serious)The VA said there is some nerve damage in his lower leg(waiting for results of testDo you have any idea what could be wrong?Thanks
title: Husband is very sick without a clear diagnosis
